page.title: 19WOODLAND IN IPSWICH.
page.content: In the South-East of Ipswich at the boundary of the towns edge there are two woodland areas. BRAZIER WOOD. This is no longer a picturesque wooded area,it has been vandalise through the use of motor-cycles and the dumping of rubbish. the future of the area is uncertain,it could be used for further housing. the ever widening paths cut through mainly deciduous trees. BRIDGE WOOD This is more protected by it's distance from having areas. The woods follow the eastern bank of the River Orwell, the banks are being eraded by the action of water. The steep slopes are covered with shrubs rather than trees,the trees being mainly deciduous.
